Room.Name: Before the Rakshasa Tower
Room.Description: You are standing before a massive tower seemingly carved from a single piece of solid granite. Black as night, the stone appears to absorb all light that comes near, and the closer you get, the less light your lanterns seem to radiate. At the base of the tower is a pair of huge doors, apparently leading inside. Up ahead you see a guard post, manned by some large tigers which seem to be standing on two feet. To the south there is an open door way leading out to the ruins.

Exit.Description: You see a guard post up ahead.

Room.Name: Guard Post Outside the Tower
Room.Description: This area teems with activity, many rakshasa and drow coming and going from the tower up ahead. There are guards stationed here, observing those coming and going, and questioning those who they deem not to belong. As you watch, one of the guards stops a young drow man, asks him a few questions, and seeming dissatisfied, proceeds to beat the young man, sending him fleeing back the way he came. You may enter the tower to the north, or return to the west.

Exit.Description: You may enter the tower in this direction.
The guard post continues in this direction.

Room.Name: Guard Post Outside the Tower
Room.Description: This area teems with activity, many rakshasa and drow coming and going from the tower up ahead. There are guards stationed here, observing those coming and going, and questioning those who they deem not to belong. As you watch, one of the guards stops a young drow man, asks him a few questions, and seeming dissatisfied, proceeds to beat the young man, sending him fleeing back the way he came. You may continue east or west.

Exit.Description: The guard post continues in this direction.
You can leave the guard post in this direction.
The guard post continues in this direction.

Room.Name: Guard Post Outside the Tower
Room.Description: This area teems with activity, many rakshasa and drow coming and going from the tower up ahead. There are guards stationed here, observing those coming and going, and questioning those who they deem not to belong. As you watch, one of the guards stops a young drow man, asks him a few questions, and seeming dissatisfied, proceeds to beat the young man, sending him fleeing back the way he came. You may continue east or west.

Exit.Description: You may enter the tower in this direction.
The guard post continues in this direction.

Room.Name: A Corridor in the Tower
Room.Description: Dark, steamy, and quiet. Too quiet. Long shadows creep up and down the walls in the flickering torchlight, occasionally obscured by the steam whisping along the floor. The flagstones here are slick with moisture, and the roof is slightly too low for comfort. You can continue into the darkness to the north or return to the east.

Exit.Description: You may continue into the darkness this way.
You see a faint light in this direction.

Room.Name: Inside the Tower
Room.Description: You are standing inside the left gate of the tower. Light spills in through the cracks around the gate, but is obscured by light wisps of steam seeming coming from nowhere. There is a sort of opressive darkness here, boding of great evil somewhere within these walls. Perhaps you should turn back now? You may continue into the tower to the east and west, or leave to the south.

Exit.Description: You may head farther into the tower this way.
You see a guard post this way.
You may head farther into the tower this way.

Room.Name: Entrance to the Dark Temple
Room.Description: Before you lies a sight like nothing you have ever seen. Tall guards stand inside the entrance to what appears to be a temple. The doorway is in the shape of a gigantic skull, with torches lit in the eye sockets for illumination. From inside you can hear a deep, resonant chanting, and occasionally a scream. You may head back into the the darkness to the east and west.

Exit.Description: You see a dark temple this way.
You may head farther into the tower this way.
You may head farther into the tower this way.

Room.Name: Inside the Tower
Room.Description: You are standing inside the left gate of the tower. Light spills in through the cracks around the gate, but is obscured by light wisps of steam seeming coming from nowhere. There is a sort of opressive darkness here, boding of great evil somewhere within these walls. Perhaps you should turn back now? You may continue into the tower to the east and west, or leave to the south.

Exit.Description: You may head farther into the tower this way.
You see a guard post this way.
You may head farther into the tower this way.

Room.Name: A Corridor in the Tower
Room.Description: Dark, steamy, and quiet. Too quiet. Long shadows creep up and down the walls in the flickering torchlight, occasionally obscured by the steam whisping along the floor. The flagstones here are slick with moisture, and the roof is slightly too low for comfort. You can continue into the darkness to the north or return to the west.

Exit.Description: You may continue into the darkness this way.
You see a faint light in this direction.

Room.Name: Barracks
Room.Description: Rows of bunks line the walls in this small alcove. Plush furs adorn the bunks, obviously used by the rakshasa guards at night. At the base of each bunk is a small footlocker, which upon examination contains little of value. The room is lit by a single lantern suspended from the ceiling. You may exit this part of the barracks to the north.

Exit.Description: You see a long torchlit corridor this way.

Room.Name: Barracks
Room.Description: Rows of bunks line the walls in this small alcove. Plush furs adorn the bunks, obviously used by the rakshasa guards at night. At the base of each bunk is a small footlocker, which upon examination contains little of value. The room is lit by a single lantern suspended from the ceiling. You may exit this part of the barracks to the north.

Exit.Description: You see a long torchlit corridor this way.

Room.Name: A Corridor in the Tower
Room.Description: Dark, steamy, and quiet. Too quiet. Long shadows creep up and down the walls in the flickering torchlight, occasionally obscured by the steam whisping along the floor. The flagstones here are slick with moisture, and the roof is slightly too low for comfort. You can continue into the darkness to the north or return to the east.

Exit.Description: You may continue into the darkness this way.
You may continue into the darkness this way.

Room.Name: A Corridor in the Tower
Room.Description: Dark, steamy, and quiet. Too quiet. Long shadows creep up and down the walls in the flickering torchlight, occasionally obscured by the steam whisping along the floor. The flagstones here are slick with moisture, and the roof is slightly too low for comfort. You can continue into the darkness to the west or return to the south.

Exit.Description: You may continue into the darkness this way.
You may continue into the darkness this way.

Room.Name: Inside the Lich Temple
Room.Description: You are standing in the southwestern corner of a Temple of the Lich. Rakshasa come here to worship the lich priest and pay their respects to their God. Towering above you is a pile of bones, many of them human and elven, which form the Lich's altar of sacrifice. The temple continues north and east.

Exit.Description: The temple continues this way.
You see the temple entrance this way.

Room.Name: Entrance to the Lich Temple
Room.Description: As you enter this temple, you are filled with a feeling of dread and fear. Evil fills the air, the chants of rakshasa sing tales of doom and dread, and rising up before you is one of the most hideous things you have ever seen. A massive pile of bones and carrion forms an altar of worship to the Lich, a revered and respected religious head in rakshasa lore. It is a testament to the sincerity of the rakshasa's hold on this land that one such as this would be here. The temple continues east and west, or you can leave to the south.

Exit.Description: The temple continues this way.
You may leave the temple in this direction.
The temple continues this way.

Room.Name: Inside the Lich Temple
Room.Description: You are standing in the southeastern corner of a Temple of the Lich. Rakshasa come here to worship the lich priest and pay their respects to their God. Towering above you is a pile of bones, many of them human and elven, which form the Lich's altar of sacrifice. The temple continues north and east.

Exit.Description: The temple continues this way.
You see the temple entrance this way.

Room.Name: A Corridor in the Tower
Room.Description: Dark, steamy, and quiet. Too quiet. Long shadows creep up and down the walls in the flickering torchlight, occasionally obscured by the steam whisping along the floor. The flagstones here are slick with moisture, and the roof is slightly too low for comfort. You can continue into the darkness to the east or return to the south.

Exit.Description: You may continue into the darkness this way.
You may continue into the darkness this way.

Room.Name: A Corridor in the Tower
Room.Description: Dark, steamy, and quiet. Too quiet. Long shadows creep up and down the walls in the flickering torchlight, occasionally obscured by the steam whisping along the floor. The flagstones here are slick with moisture, and the roof is slightly too low for comfort. You can continue into the darkness to the north or return to the west.

Exit.Description: You may continue into the darkness this way.
You may continue into the darkness this way.

Room.Name: Barracks
Room.Description: Rows of bunks line the walls in this small alcove. Plush furs adorn the bunks, obviously used by the rakshasa guards at night. At the base of each bunk is a small footlocker, which upon examination contains little of value. The room is lit by a single lantern suspended from the ceiling. You may exit this part of the barracks to the north.

Exit.Description: You see a long torchlit corridor this way.

Room.Name: Barracks
Room.Description: Rows of bunks line the walls in this small alcove. Plush furs adorn the bunks, obviously used by the rakshasa guards at night. At the base of each bunk is a small footlocker, which upon examination contains little of value. The room is lit by a single lantern suspended from the ceiling. You may exit this part of the barracks to the north.

Exit.Description: You see a long torchlit corridor this way.

Room.Name: Officer's Quarters
Room.Description: This room is different to the normal barracks. The beds are single, not bunks, and next to each is a small writing desk, obviously for filling out forms and such. The trappings on the bunks are more plush than those in the regular barracks, and the footlockers are larger, but equally as uninteresting. You may return to the barracks to the east.

Exit.Description: You see a long torchlit corridor this way.

Room.Name: Corridor in the Barracks
Room.Description: You are standing in a spartan corridor in what appears to be a soldier's barracks. There are schedules for guard changes on the walls, and lists of names indicating merit or lack thereof. You notice three different lists, each of which being a different color, black, red or brown, indicating status in the King's guard. You see small alcoves to the north and south, a door to the west, or you can return to the east.

Exit.Description: You see a small alcove this way.
You see a long torchlit corridor this way.
You see a small alcove this way.
You see a small room this way.

Room.Name: Corridor in the Barracks
Room.Description: You are standing in a spartan corridor in what appears to be a soldier's barracks. There are schedules for guard changes on the walls, and lists of names indicating merit or lack thereof. You notice three different lists, each of which being a different color, black, red or brown, indicating status in the King's guard. You see small alcoves to the north and south, or you can return to the east. The barracks continue to the west.

Exit.Description: You see a small alcove this way.
You may head back into the darkness this way.
You see a small alcove this way.
You see a long torchlit corridor this way.

Room.Name: A Corridor in the Tower
Room.Description: Dark, steamy, and quiet. Too quiet. Long shadows creep up and down the walls in the flickering torchlight, occasionally obscured by the steam whisping along the floor. The flagstones here are slick with moisture, and the roof is slightly too low for comfort. You can continue into the darkness to the north or return to the south. You see light coming from a corridor to the west.

Exit.Description: You may continue into the darkness this way.
You may continue into the darkness this way.
You see a long torchlit corridor this way.

Room.Name: Alcove in the Temple
Room.Description: You are standing in a small alcove off the main temple. Squat wooden benches lined with furs sit here in rows. Worshippers wait here before paying their respects to the Lich, although it appears to be rather quiet at the moment. In the north wall you see the faint outline of a door. You can enter the temple to the east.

Exit.Description: You may continue into the darkness this way.
You can return to the temple in this direction.

Room.Name: Inside the Lich Temple
Room.Description: You are standing on the western side of a Temple of the Lich. Rakshasa come here to worship the lich priest and pay their respects to their God. Towering above you is a pile of bones, many of them human and elven, which form the Lich's altar of sacrifice. The temple continues north and south. You see a small alcove to the west.

Exit.Description: You can continue into the temple this way.
You can continue into the temple this way.
You see a small alcove in this direction.

Room.Name: Atop the Tower of Carrion
Room.Description: You are currently standing atop the tower of carrion, before the Altar of the Lich. The floor here is made up of femurs of humans and elves, slick with thick blood of recent sacrifices. There is an altar of human skulls standing in the centre of the tower where the sacrifices to the Dark Lord are made. Behind this altar is the throne of the Lich himself. The only way out of here is back down the tower.

Exit.Description: You can head back down the bone steps in this direction.

Room.Name: Inside the Lich Temple
Room.Description: You are standing on the eastern side of a Temple of the Lich. Rakshasa come here to worship the lich priest and pay their respects to their God. Towering above you is a pile of bones, many of them human and elven, which form the Lich's altar of sacrifice. The temple continues north and south. You see a small alcove to the east.

Exit.Description: You can continue into the temple this way.
You see a small alcove in this direction.
You can continue into the temple this way.

Room.Name: Alcove in the Temple
Room.Description: You are standing in a small alcove off the main temple. Squat wooden benches lined with furs sit here in rows. Worshippers wait here before paying their respects to the Lich, although it appears to be rather quiet at the moment. In the north wall you see the faint outline of a door. You can enter the temple to the west.

Exit.Description: You may continue into the darkness this way.
You can return to the temple in this direction.

Room.Name: A Corridor in the Tower
Room.Description: Dark, steamy, and quiet. Too quiet. Long shadows creep up and down the walls in the flickering torchlight, occasionally obscured by the steam whisping along the floor. The flagstones here are slick with moisture, and the roof is slightly too low for comfort. You can continue into the darkness to the north or return to the south. You see light coming from a corridor to the east.

Exit.Description: You may continue into the darkness this way.
You see a long torchlit corridor this way.
You may continue into the darkness this way.

Room.Description: You are standing in a spartan corridor in what appears to be a soldier's barracks. There are schedules for guard changes on the walls, and lists of names indicating merit or lack thereof. You notice three different lists, each of which being a different color, black, red or brown, indicating status in the King's guard. You see small alcoves to the north and south, or you can return to the west. The barracks continue to the east.

Exit.Description: You see a small alcove this way.
You see a long torchlit corridor this way.
You see a small alcove this way.
You may continue into the darkness this way.

Room.Name: Corridor in the Barracks
Room.Description: You are standing in a spartan corridor in what appears to be a soldier's barracks. There are schedules for guard changes on the walls, and lists of names indicating merit or lack thereof. You notice three different lists, each of which being a different color, black, red or brown, indicating status in the King's guard. You see small alcoves to the north and south, a door to the east, or you can return to the west.

Exit.Description: You see a small alcove this way.
You see a small room this way.
You see a small alcove this way.
You see a long torchlit corridor this way.

Room.Name: Officer's Quarters
Room.Description: This room is different to the normal barracks. The beds are single, not bunks, and next to each is a small writing desk, obviously for filling out forms and such. The trappings on the bunks are more plush than those in the regular barracks, and the footlockers are larger, but equally as uninteresting. You may return to the barracks to the west.

Exit.Description: You see a long torchlit corridor this way.

Room.Description: Rows of bunks line the walls in this small alcove. Plush furs adorn the bunks, obviously used by the rakshasa guards at night. At the base of each bunk is a small footlocker, which upon examination contains little of value. The room is lit by a single lantern suspended from the ceiling. You may exit this part of the barracks to the south.

Exit.Description: You see a long torchlit corridor this way.

Room.Description: Rows of bunks line the walls in this small alcove. Plush furs adorn the bunks, obviously used by the rakshasa guards at night. At the base of each bunk is a small footlocker, which upon examination contains little of value. The room is lit by a single lantern suspended from the ceiling. You may exit this part of the barracks to the south.

Exit.Description: You see a long torchlit corridor this way.

Room.Description: Dark, steamy, and quiet. Too quiet. Long shadows creep up and down the walls in the flickering torchlight, occasionally obscured by the steam whisping along the floor. The flagstones here are slick with moisture, and the roof is slightly too low for comfort. You can continue into the darkness to the east or return to the south.

Exit.Description: You may continue into the darkness this way.
You may continue into the darkness this way.

Room.Name: A Corridor in the Tower
Room.Description: Dark, steamy, and quiet. Too quiet. Long shadows creep up and down the walls in the flickering torchlight, occasionally obscured by the steam whisping along the floor. The flagstones here are slick with moisture, and the roof is slightly too low for comfort. You can continue into the darkness to the north or return to the west. You see the faint outline of a door to the south.

Exit.Description: You may continue into the darkness this way.
You see a small alcove in this direction.
You may continue into the darkness this way.

Room.Name: Inside the Lich Temple
Room.Description: You are standing on the northwestern corner of a Temple of the Lich. Rakshasa come here to worship the lich priest and pay their respects to their God. Towering above you is a pile of bones, many of them human and elven, which form the Lich's altar of sacrifice. The temple continues east and south.

Exit.Description: You can continue into the temple this way.
You can continue into the temple this way.

Room.Name: Inside the Lich Temple
Room.Description: You are standing on the northern side of a Temple of the Lich. Rakshasa come here to worship the lich priest and pay their respects to their God. Towering above you is a pile of bones, many of them human and elven, which form the Lich's altar of sacrifice. From here you can see a staircase of bones, slick with blood, leading up to the top of the tower of carrion. The temple continues east and west.

Exit.Description: You can head up the bony stairs this way.

Room.Name: Inside the Lich Temple
Room.Description: You are standing on the northwestern corner of a Temple of the Lich. Rakshasa come here to worship the lich priest and pay their respects to their God. Towering above you is a pile of bones, many of them human and elven, which form the Lich's altar of sacrifice. The temple continues east and south.

Exit.Description: You can continue into the temple this way.
You can continue into the temple this way.

Room.Name: A Corridor in the Tower
Room.Description: Dark, steamy, and quiet. Too quiet. Long shadows creep up and down the walls in the flickering torchlight, occasionally obscured by the steam whisping along the floor. The flagstones here are slick with moisture, and the roof is slightly too low for comfort. You can continue into the darkness to the north or return to the east. You see the faint outline of a door to the south.

Exit.Description: You may continue into the darkness this way.
You may continue into the darkness this way.
You see a small alcove in this direction.

Room.Name: A Corridor in the Tower
Room.Description: Dark, steamy, and quiet. Too quiet. Long shadows creep up and down the walls in the flickering torchlight, occasionally obscured by the steam whisping along the floor. The flagstones here are slick with moisture, and the roof is slightly too low for comfort. You can continue into the darkness to the west or return to the south.

Exit.Description: You may continue into the darkness this way.
You may continue into the darkness this way.

Room.Name: Barracks
Room.Description: Rows of bunks line the walls in this small alcove. Plush furs adorn the bunks, obviously used by the rakshasa guards at night. At the base of each bunk is a small footlocker, which upon examination contains little of value. The room is lit by a single lantern suspended from the ceiling. You may exit this part of the barracks to the south.

Exit.Description: You see a long torchlit corridor this way.

Room.Name: Barracks
Room.Description: Rows of bunks line the walls in this small alcove. Plush furs adorn the bunks, obviously used by the rakshasa guards at night. At the base of each bunk is a small footlocker, which upon examination contains little of value. The room is lit by a single lantern suspended from the ceiling. You may exit this part of the barracks to the south.

Exit.Description: You see a long torchlit corridor this way.

Room.Name: A Corridor in the Tower
Room.Description: Dark, steamy, and quiet. Too quiet. Long shadows creep up and down the walls in the flickering torchlight, occasionally obscured by the steam whisping along the floor. The flagstones here are slick with moisture, and the roof is slightly too low for comfort. You can continue into the darkness to the east or return to the south.

Exit.Description: You may continue into the darkness this way.
You may continue into the darkness this way.

Room.Name: A Corridor in the Tower
Room.Description: Dark, steamy, and quiet. Too quiet. Long shadows creep up and down the walls in the flickering torchlight, occasionally obscured by the steam whisping along the floor. The flagstones here are slick with moisture, and the roof is slightly too low for comfort. You can continue into the darkness to the north or return to the west.

Exit.Description: You may continue into the darkness this way.
You may continue into the darkness this way.

Room.Name: Antechamber
Room.Description: This small room is furnished with some of the finest furs and wall hangings that you have seen yet. Along the walls are several plush chairs and small tables containing various refreshments. Guests wait here before going in to see the King, but this doesn't mean they shouldn't be comfortable. You can exit the antechamber to the north.

Exit.Description: You see a well lit room in this direction.

Room.Name: A Corridor in the Tower
Room.Description: Dark, steamy, and quiet. Too quiet. Long shadows creep up and down the walls in the flickering torchlight, occasionally obscured by the steam whisping along the floor. The flagstones here are slick with moisture, and the roof is slightly too low for comfort. You can continue into the darkness to the north or return to the east.

Exit.Description: You may continue into the darkness this way.
You may continue into the darkness this way.

Room.Name: A Corridor in the Tower
Room.Description: Dark, steamy, and quiet. Too quiet. Long shadows creep up and down the walls in the flickering torchlight, occasionally obscured by the steam whisping along the floor. The flagstones here are slick with moisture, and the roof is slightly too low for comfort. You can continue into the darkness to the west or return to the south.

Exit.Description: You may continue into the darkness this way.
You may continue into the darkness this way.

Room.Name: A Corridor in the Tower
Room.Description: Dark, steamy, and quiet. Too quiet. Long shadows creep up and down the walls in the flickering torchlight, occasionally obscured by the steam whisping along the floor. The flagstones here are slick with moisture, and the roof is slightly too low for comfort. You can see a brightly lit room to the east, or return to the south.

Exit.Description: You see a well lit room in this direction.
You may continue into the darkness this way.

Room.Name: Before the Throne room
Room.Description: Standing here you know majesty. This room is lit by large sconces on the walls adorned with precious stones of all descriptions. The floor is of polished granite overlaid with fine rugs and pelts. In the centre of the room is a large crystal chandelier lit by over 50 candles which throws sparkling light over everything in the room. Tall golden doors fill the north wall, and you can see a smaller alcove to the south.

Exit.Description: You may enter the throne room this way.
You may continue into the darkness this way.
You see an antechamber in this direction.
You may continue into the darkness this way.

Room.Name: A Corridor in the Tower
Room.Description: Dark, steamy, and quiet. Too quiet. Long shadows creep up and down the walls in the flickering torchlight, occasionally obscured by the steam whisping along the floor. The flagstones here are slick with moisture, and the roof is slightly too low for comfort. You can see a brightly lit room to the west, or return to the south.

Exit.Description: You may continue into the darkness this way.
You may continue into the darkness this way.

Room.Name: Entrance of the Throne Room
Room.Description: You are standing in the entrance area of the King's throne room. Valuable furs and gold leaf are everywhere, opulence seeming to be a part of life for the King and his family. The vaulted ceilings are so high that you can't see all of them, and the walls are made of black granite with gold flecks. This huge room extends far to the north, or you can exit through the double doors to the south.

Exit.Description: The throne room extends as far as the eye can see this way.
You see a well lit room in this direction.

Room.Name: King's Chambers
Room.Description: You are standing in a small side-room of the King's chambers, which appears to be used for nothing more than closet space. There are racks of clothing here covering three out of four walls, and dozens of pairs of furry slippers on the floor. You can return to the main chambers to the north.

Exit.Description: You can return to the King's chambers this way.

Room.Name: Prince's Chambers
Room.Description: You are standing in the bedchamber of the rakshasa Prince. There is a large fur covered bed sitting in the centre of the room, and a tall changing screen in one corner, obviously for the benefit of his mistresses. There are lurid tapestries on the wall showing all types of erotic scenes, the centrepiece being one showing the Prince himself. You may exit to the east.

Exit.Description: You can head back into the main chamber this way.

Room.Name: Prince's Chambers
Room.Description: This is the main chamber in the Prince's quarters. It has 3 plush couches along the walls for guests to relax on, and a pair of smaller tables containing refreshments. There is a large, decorative rug on the granite floor and a chandelier hung from the ceiling. You can continue into the Prince's chambers to the west, or leave through the door in the east wall.

Exit.Description: You see a small alcove in this direction.
You can continue into the Prince's chambers this way.

Room.Name: West Alcove of the Throne Room
Room.Description: This is a small alcove off the west side of the throne room. It is lit by a pair of flaming torches, one on each wall. On the west wall is a pair of curtains covering a heavy wooden door. There is also a pair of curtains on the eastern entrance to hide this alcove from the throne room proper.

Exit.Description: The throne room extends as far as the eye can see this way.
You can head into the Prince's quarters this way.

Room.Name: The Throne Room
Room.Description: Stupendous, opulent beyond belief, you stand in the throne room of the rakshasa King. Polished granite highlighted with carved gold inlays are features of this enormous room, but the massive crystal chandelier lit by magical globes is possibly the single most marvellous thing you have ever seen. Furs, rugs, tapestries, fine metals, gemstones all are in abundance here, fixed into the furnishings here. There are piles of soft cushions for dignitaries to rest upon whilst talking to the king, and tables filled with every delicacy imaginable lining the edges of the room. Just to the north is the King's throne, and you can see curtains east and west covering small alcoves.

Exit.Description: You can see the King's throne in this direction.
You see a small alcove in this direction.
You can head back out of the throne room this way.
You see a small alcove in this direction.

Room.Name: West Alcove of the Throne Room
Room.Description: This is a small alcove off the west side of the throne room. It is lit by a pair of flaming torches, one on each wall. On the east wall is a pair of curtains covering a heavy wooden door. There is also a pair of curtains on the western entrance to hide this alcove from the throne room proper.

Exit.Description: You can head into the King's quarters this way.
The throne room extends as far as the eye can see this way.

Room.Name: King's Chambers
Room.Description: You are standing in the centre of the King's private chambers. There is a small desk and chair here, and a small but comfortable sofa. On the walls there are several ceremonial swords and shields, made of various precious metals, and as such unsuitable for battle. The room is very much different from the throne room outside, having almost no luxuries, but instead being quite spartan and neat. The throne room continues north and south. On the east wall you see a very large reinforced door.

Exit.Description: The King's chambers continue in this direction.
You see a small room in this direction.
The King's chambers continue in this direction.
You see a small alcove in this direction.

Room.Name: King's Treasure Chamber
Room.Description: This is a small, fortified room with a steel-lined door, and a large chest bolted to the floor. The walls aren't finished smoothly like the rest of the tower, but instead have been left rough, you don't know why. You can, however, see various stains on the walls which appear to be the blood of former pilferers...

Exit.Description: You can return to the King's chambers this way.

Room.Name: Before the King's Throne
Room.Description: You are standing before the King's throne. Finely crafted from rare woods, gold and cut rubies, you are duly impressed by this throne. It stands on a pedestal of polished black granite and is upholstered in fine velvet. Behind the throne is a rack for the King to store his sword and shield handy for any emergency. You can return to the throne room to the south.

Exit.Description: The throne room extends as far as the eye can see this way.

Room.Name: King's Chambers
Room.Description: You are now in the King's private bedchamber. Along one wall is a large but relatively plain single bed. On the walls are two tapestries, both depicting scenes of war and bloodshed. The floor is polished granite, but there are no rugs to warm the floor, only cold hard stone. It seems the King doesn't wish to become soft in his reign. You can return to the main part of the chambers to the south.

Exit.Description: You can return to the King's chambers this way.

NPC.name: black rakshasa
NPC.description: The sleek black fur on this creature strongly suggests a night hunting predator, and the cold hard eyes that stare at you chill you to the bone. Unlike other rakshasa that live to hoard treasure, the black one lives to kill, and it surrenders the noble part of it's mind to the tiger in it.
NPC.longDescription: A tiger headed creature with pure black fur is here.
NPC.affectedBy: DetectEvil DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Infrared DetectIllusion

NPC.name: red rakshasa
NPC.description: The red blood coloured fur on the rakshasa indicates it's royal lineage, althugh it has been a long time since any rakshasa dynasty ruled on the mortal planes. Now this proud beast is reduced to the life of a scavanger in the ruins of the ancient cities.
NPC.longDescription: A tiger headed creature with blood red fur is here.
NPC.affectedBy: DetectEvil DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Infrared DetectIllusion

NPC.name: brown rakshasa
NPC.description: One of the most common rakshasa, the brown caste represent the majority of the deadly race. Thie ones within the ruins are some of the last remaining ones on the mortal planes, and they are weary of this life, no longer as powerful as they once were.
NPC.longDescription: A tiger headed creature dark brown fur is here.
NPC.affectedBy: DetectEvil DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Infrared DetectIllusion

NPC.name: rakshasa lich
NPC.description: This undead creature is the remains of the ancient rakshasa priest who served among the great rakshasa dynasty. Now, with the rakshasa kingdom gone, it lives here in the last of the dying domains of the rakshasa race. Eventually it will abandon even these last rakshasa and seek it's immortal destiny among the outer planes.
NPC.longDescription: A horribly disfigured rakshasa with burning red eyes is here.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Undead Cleric Warrior AreaAttack AssistVnum
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Sanctuary DetectIllusion Flying PassDoor DarkVision

NPC.name: rakshasa prince
NPC.description: Although nominally just the next in line to rule the rakshasa's remaining domain here in the ruins, Daedalus actually exerts the true control. His father the king has already succumbed to despair and rules only by tradition.
NPC.longDescription: A regal looking rakshasa stands here dictating over his domain.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Warrior AreaAttack AssistVnum
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Sanctuary Infrared DetectIllusion

NPC.name: twoheaded twohead two-headed two rakshasa
NPC.description: This abomination is the semi-successful experiment of the rakshasa high priest in his attempts to make a more powerful solider for the rakshasa's. In the war against the drow and beholder they are no longer able to hold their own, and have fallen back to the despicable magics of necromancy and transformation.
NPC.longDescription: A two-headed rakshasa is here dripping blood from it's kills.

NPC.name: zombie drow
NPC.description: This is one of the uses of drows killed in the current war between the rakshasa and the drows and beholders of Myth Drannor. Rather than waste the corpses the high priest has used them as personal slaves.
NPC.longDescription: The zombie of a dark-elf is standing here.
NPC.shortDescription: the zombie of a dark-elven warrior
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden DetectIllusion PassDoor DarkVision

NPC.name: rakshasa king
NPC.description: Majestic-looking rakshasa growling at your presence. His golden mitre flash brightly and crown of pure gold on his head looks like symbol of might. It's a rakshasa king who rule his fallen kingdom and prepare self for the raid against his enemies.
NPC.longDescription: The royal rakshasa king stands here pacing and growling.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Warrior AreaAttack AssistVnum
NPC.affectedBy: DetectInvis DetectMagic DetectHidden Sanctuary Infrared DetectIllusion

NPC.name: tiger
NPC.description: It is one of the largest creatures you have ever seen, almost the size of a small dragon, and certainly the largest tiger you have ever heard of.
NPC.longDescription: The royal rakshasa tiger pet is here prowling in agitation.
NPC.flags: NPC Sentinel StayArea Warrior AreaAttack AssistVnum

Item.Name: parchment red seal
Item.LongDescription: A piece of parchment with red tinted writing is here.

Item.Name: claw black rakshasa
Item.LongDescription: A large set of black claws is here.

Item.Name: claws red rakshasa
Item.ShortDescription: the claws of a red rakshasa
Item.LongDescription: A set of red rakshasa claws are on the ground.

Item.Name: claws brown rakshasa
Item.ShortDescription: a pair of brown rakshasa claws
Item.LongDescription: A pair of brown claws are lying on the floor.

Item.Name: sceptre gold
Item.LongDescription: A sceptre made of pure gold lies on the ground.

Item.Name: serpent twined ring
Item.LongDescription: A ring in the form of an entwined serpent is here.

Item.Name: black coat fur rakshasa
Item.ShortDescription: a coat of black rakshasa fur
Item.LongDescription: A large pile of black fur is on the ground.

Item.Name: dual dual-bladed axe beholderkin slayer
Item.LongDescription: A huge axe with two sharp sides is lying on the ground.

Item.Name: blood collar
Item.LongDescription: A collar covered in sticky blood is on the ground.

Item.Name: red ioun stone
Item.LongDescription: A deep red stone hums softly as it hovers in the air.

ExtraDescription.Description: It seems to be humming and just floating, doing nothing...

Item.Name: signet ring royal rakshasa
Item.LongDescription: A large distinct ring with royal markings is on the ground.

Item.Name: golden crown gold
Item.LongDescription: A golden crown has been left sitting on the floor.

Item.Name: necklace diamond
Item.LongDescription: A string of sparkling diamonds is here.

Item.Name: steel shield emblem rakshasa pride
Item.LongDescription: A large plate of steel bearing the mark of the rakshasa is here.

Item.Name: claw tiger
Item.ShortDescription: the claw of a massive tiger
Item.LongDescription: A huge, deadly looking tiger claw is lying here.
